simba3d Package¶

simba3d Package¶

Structure Inference from Multiscale BAyes in 3 Dimensions (SIMBA3D)

Python tools for reconstructing 3D architecture from single cell pairwise interaction matrices.

dependencies:
  • matplotlib
  • numpy
  • scipy

convertion_tool Module¶

Command line convertion tool for simba3d outputs

This will convert npz outputs from simba3d to some other outputs

Created on Tue Jan 16 10:04:17 2018

@author: Michael Rosenthal

main function executing the convertion tool

simba3d.convertion_tool.printhelp()[source]¶

print the help text for the convertion tool

graphical_results Module¶

Display graphical results from simba3d.opt_E object.

These used to be in the opt_E class itself, but I separated it so that matplotlib is not required to run the optimizer.

Created on Thu Sep 07 11:40:43 2017

@author: Michael Rosenthal

simba3d.graphical_results.create_images_from_task(task)[source]¶

Will load the individual task (if possible) and plot the relavent images

plot the evolution

plot the estimated curve stored in the instance

simba3d.graphical_results.plot_initialized_curve(result, ax=None, fig=None)[source]¶

plot the curve used to initiailize the gradient ascent algorithm

matrixlabish Module¶

An assortment of low level functions that I use. Some of them resemble functions similiar to a popular matrix laboratory.

simba3d.matrixlabish.cls()¶
simba3d.matrixlabish.differencematrix(p0, p1=None)[source]¶

given two sets of points p0 (mX2 array) and p1 (nX2 array), compute the pairwise differance matrixes xdiff,ydiff (mXn arrays)

simba3d.matrixlabish.distancematrix(p0, p1=None, getangles=False)[source]¶

given two sets of points p0 (mX2 array) and p1 (nX2 array), compute the pairwise distance matrix D (mXn arra)

simba3d.matrixlabish.file_len(fname)[source]¶

This counts the length of a file. Just got threwn in here because it is low level

simba3d.matrixlabish.float_range(start, step, stop)[source]¶

Function that mimics the start:step:stop

class simba3d.matrixlabish.getlines(fig)[source]¶

like getpts, but with line in between

on_click(event)[source]¶
on_key(event)[source]¶
class simba3d.matrixlabish.getpts(fig)[source]¶

like getpts

on_click(event)[source]¶
on_key(event)[source]¶

like getpts

on_click(event)[source]¶
on_key(event)[source]¶
simba3d.matrixlabish.keyboard(banner=None)[source]¶

Function that mimics the keyboard command

simba3d.matrixlabish.significant_figures(x, sig=4)[source]¶

create string without decimal points for file names

simba3d.matrixlabish.whos()¶

mp_manager Module¶

Simplified multi processing wrapper for simba3d

The mp_handler can be called by inputing a list of tasks and specifying the desired number of cores. Selecting the optimal number of cores can be a bit subjective. Generally, one uses the number of virtual cores available on the system.

Created on Wed Sep 06 18:59:03 2017

@author: Michael Rosenthal

simba3d.mp_manager.convert(filename, ext_out='.npz')[source]¶

convert .npz simba3d result into some other supported format

simba3d.mp_manager.get_outputfilepath(task)[source]¶

returns the output file path of a task

simba3d.mp_manager.get_tag_name(task)[source]¶

Gets a tag name (this may go away in future versions)

simba3d.mp_manager.jsonify(data)[source]¶

This is a small serializer for saving output in human readable json format

simba3d.mp_manager.load_data(task)[source]¶

potential problem here, this only loads numpy arrays npy files

simba3d.mp_manager.load_result(outputfile)[source]¶

This will load a simba3d result

simba3d.mp_manager.mp_handler(tasks, cores)[source]¶

This handles the multi processing

simba3d.mp_manager.mp_worker(task)[source]¶
simba3d.mp_manager.run_task(task)[source]¶

run a singular task

simba3d.mp_manager.run_tasks(tasks, resume=True)[source]¶

plural task runner.

This runs a list of independent tasks and divides the work across multiple processes if desired.

Ther resume option tells simba3d to skip over tasks with uuid’s that have already been ran.

simba3d.mp_manager.save_data(outputfilepath, summary)[source]¶

This will save a simba3d result

Summary is the result of the experiment

simba3d.mp_manager.summarize_results(result, task)[source]¶

creates a summary of the result as dict

optimizer Module¶

Optimization tools are are defined here.

A ptyhon class called opt_E manages the scipy optimize options and creates a friendlier user interface.

Created on Thu Apr 20 10:26:05 2017

@author: Michael Rosenthal

simba3d.optimizer.analytical_data_gradient(curve, pairwise_contact_matrix, a, b, offdiag=1, idxmiss=None, idxlist=None)[source]¶

compute log-likelihood gradient analytically

simba3d.optimizer.analytical_data_gradient0(curve, pairwise_contact_matrix, a, b, index)[source]¶

compute log-likelihood gradient analytically

simba3d.optimizer.analytical_roughness_gradient(curve, S, term_weights)[source]¶

analytically compute the gradient of the roughness using the sparce S matrix.

simba3d.optimizer.compute_pairwise_distance(curve)[source]¶

Compute the pairwise distance matrix of a parametrized curve

This function assumes that the longer dimension is the dimension of the parameterization. The reason for this is to avoid errors caused by transposing the matrix.

simba3d.optimizer.create_S1(n)[source]¶

create sparce matrix to quickly compute first order roughness gradient

simba3d.optimizer.create_S2(n)[source]¶

create sparce matrix to quickly compute second order roughness gradient

simba3d.optimizer.dif(x1, x2)[source]¶
simba3d.optimizer.energy_roughness(curve)[source]¶

compute roughness 1rst and 2nd order measure

simba3d.optimizer.energy_scale_invariant_first_roughness_gradient(curve, S=None)[source]¶

scale invariant roughness penalty gradient

simba3d.optimizer.energy_scale_invariant_second_roughness_gradient(curve, S=None)[source]¶

scale invariant roughness penalty gradient

simba3d.optimizer.energy_shape_prior(curve, shape_model)[source]¶

compute energy and gradient of the shape prior

simba3d.optimizer.h1penalty(curve, S1)[source]¶

Compute the h1 penalty and its gradient.

The penalty can be interpreted as the sample variance of the normalized curve

simba3d.optimizer.h2penalty(curve)[source]¶

Compute the h2 penalty and its gradient.

the average cos( heta_i), where heta_i is the angle between the triplet (x_{i-1},x_i,x_{i+1}).

simba3d.optimizer.listIndices(n, offdiag)[source]¶

List the pairs of index values (i,j) that indicate the upper triangular entries of an n x n matrix.

Inputs:
n - The size of the square matrix. offdiag - An integer value indicating the first off-diagonal to contain usable data in the matrix C (usually offdiag = 1).
Outputs:
idx - An nchoosek(n,2) x 2 matrix consisting of the (i,j) index combinations such that i<j.
simba3d.optimizer.loglikelihood_Varoquaux(pairwise_distance_matrix, a, b, pairwise_contact_matrix)[source]¶

the loglikelihood function using the poisson model proposed in the Varoquaux paper.

class simba3d.optimizer.opt_E(data, parameters=None, options=None)[source]¶

Primary optimization manager for simba3d

This class manages defaults and data storage for the results. Basically, it is a wraper for the scipy optimizer, but it stores results and manages input parameters.

accelerate_gradient_ascent_algorithm(cbfun=None, options=None, delta0=None)[source]¶
callback(xk)[source]¶

lightweight callback without storing iterative result or printing iterative value

callbackdisp(xk)[source]¶

display iteration during callback

callbackdispstore(xk)[source]¶

display iteration during callback and store iterative result

callbackstore(xk)[source]¶

store iterative result without displaying during iterations

check_jacobian()[source]¶
energy_jacobian(curve, *args)[source]¶

analytically compute energy and jacobian energy

get_data function call for creating animation

run()[source]¶
t = None¶
index is no longer used, it has been replaced with pairwise_combinations

# index of contact matrix to use in calculation of log-likelihood term if ‘index’ not in data:

data[‘index’]=np.triu(np.ones((self.n,self.n)),1)==1 #print “No index provided for log-likelihood term!

simba3d.optimizer.parametrization_error(curve, true_square_root_speed=None, t=None)[source]¶

Error of the curve parameterization given a square roor speed.

If the true square root speed is not specified, then uniform speed is used by default.

simba3d.optimizer.penalized_log_likelihood(curve, t, pairwise_contact_matrix, a, b, term_weights, square_root_speed=None, pairwise_distance_matrix=None)[source]¶

penalized log likelihood

simba3d.optimizer.scale_initialized_curve(curve, pairwise_contact_matrix, a, b, index, idxmiss)[source]¶

optimally scale the curve to the data for fewer iterations

exception simba3d.optimizer.stop_optimizing_exception[source]¶

Bases: exceptions.Exception

Inner product in the Q space

center the curve to the origin

Convert function from square root velocity space back to the original function space

simba3d.srvf_open_curve_Rn.extrap(x, xp, yp)[source]¶

np.interp with linear extrapolation

simba3d.srvf_open_curve_Rn.find_best_ortho(curve1, curve2)[source]¶

Optimally rotate or reflect the second curve to the first curve

simba3d.srvf_open_curve_Rn.find_best_rotation(curve1, curve2)[source]¶

Optimally rotate the second curve to the first curve

simba3d.srvf_open_curve_Rn.gradient(curve)[source]¶

row-wise gradient for unifromly sampled curve

simba3d.srvf_open_curve_Rn.interp(t, X, tnew=None)[source]¶

interpolation with linear extrapoltion

simba3d.srvf_open_curve_Rn.length(curve, t=None)[source]¶

Return the length of a parametrized curve

simba3d.srvf_open_curve_Rn.q_to_curve(q)[source]¶

Convert function from square root velocity space back to the original function space

simba3d.srvf_open_curve_Rn.resample_curve(curve, N)[source]¶

resample a parametrized curve uniformly at N time points

simba3d.srvf_open_curve_Rn.roughness2(curve, t=None)[source]¶

Return the first (same as length) and second order roughness measure of a parametrized curve

The first and second order gradient are computed numerically, and the roughness measure is simply the Frobenious norm of first and second order gradients.

If the temperal parametrization t is not specified then the curve is assumed to be parametrized uniformly over the interval [0,1]

simba3d.srvf_open_curve_Rn.scale_curve(curve, t=None)[source]¶

Scale a curve to unit length

simba3d.srvf_open_curve_Rn.standardize_curves(curves)[source]¶

First removes translation and scale, and then rotates the remaining curves to first curve.

simba3d.srvf_open_curve_Rn.standarize_curve(curve)[source]¶

center the curve to the origin

uuid_check Module¶

Tools for checking if a file with a specific uuid already exists

Created on Tue Oct 3 08:51:56 2017

@author: Michael Rosenthal

simba3d.uuid_check.check_status(tasks)[source]¶

Checks each task in a list of task has not already been completed.

returns the number of task finish and the total number of task for each subtask

simba3d.uuid_check.check_tasks(tasks)[source]¶

Checks each task in a list of task has not already been completed

simba3d.uuid_check.check_tasks_index(tasks)[source]¶

Checks each task in a list of task has not already been completed and returns integer index of remaining tasks

simba3d.uuid_check.check_tasks_indexs(tasks)[source]¶

Checks each task in a list of task has not already been completed and returns integer index of remaining tasks

simba3d.uuid_check.get_remaining_tasks(taskfilepath, results_dir)[source]¶

Find tasks in the taskfilepath that are not in the results_dir directory.

simba3d.uuid_check.get_uuid_from_directory(results_dir)[source]¶

load all the files in the specified results directory and extract the uuid.

This is useful for determining which files have already been run.

simba3d.uuid_check.get_uuid_from_tasklist(taskfilepath)[source]¶

Load a tasklist and get all the uuid

This is useful for determining which files have already been run.

simba3d.uuid_check.get_uuid_from_tasks(tasks)[source]¶

Find uuid of tasks in the already load list of tasks

simba3d.uuid_check.get_uuid_remaining_tasks(taskfilepath, results_dir)[source]¶

Find uuid of tasks in the taskfilepath that are not in the results_dir directory.
